title: (x) Country in the city - AT Solid Antique Roman {Tiff}
content:
This was found by a client in a magazine and she really likes it. after much internet searching I gave up and came straight to the experts. It's not as cool as my mn daily font id.   
   
t1mmy   
   
 ![country](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014221218im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/12272.jpg)
author: t1mmy

comments.content:
Reminds me of a poorly drawn Didot . . .   
   
Stuart :D
Yeah, Didot with a country vernacular

We had [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014221218/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/9063.html) a while ago with all these deliciously   
quirky period types. You just gotta love them. I do.
